An àite seo innse do Flop, tha Bing ga chuir dhan bhiona. Tha e faireachdainn cho dona mun seo ach tha e ag ionnsachadh gum feum e innse mar a thachair. When Bing is playing a game with Flop’s mobile phone, he accidentally drops the mobile and it breaks. Instead of telling Flop, he throws it in the bin. He feels upset about it all and learns that it’s best to tell the truth.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma watch the fireworks at Bings house. Sula doesnt like the loud bangs, so she wears ear mufflers. Bing, on the other hand, thinks he is brave enough to watch the fireworks from the garden. All of a sudden, a very loud bang sends Bing running into the house and hiding under the kitchen table. Flop makes special ear gloves for Bing to enjoy the fireworks show without having to hear the loud bangs.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry wants to perform magic, but Stanley and Balthazar tease him. Berry borrows Katies magic box, learns tricks, and puts on a show for his friends. The tricks amaze the audience, especially when Berry successfully performs real magic by summoning rain.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The little friends decide to get rid of their old, unwanted items and organize a yard sale in the meadow. The old items lead to a lively barter, but a large pile of useless junk remains. The rubbishtruck of the quick beetles arrives to help, taking away the remaining items and assisting in cleaning the meadow.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble catches a cold, and Dr. Owl suggests drinking elderflower tea. Flutter sets out to gather elderflowers and meets Harmony, the glass-winged butterfly. Harmony teaches Flutter how to make the tea properly. Thanks to the delicious drink, Bubble soon recovers, and they celebrate spring with their new friend Harmony over a tasty elderflower syrup.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, finds a strange little fish in the stream, which turns out to be a lost polliwog. Although Alfonso is sad when the polliwog returns to its frog family, their friendship doesnt end. Alfonso visits his tadpole friend every day, who soon develops into a real little frog.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle, Lowly and Sally find a lost bag, they use the eyeglass case, atomizer, map, and a red scarf inside it to determine that the owner is a famous international opera star who’s come to Busytown to perform for the first time./Cyclists getting flat tires somewhere in Busytown lead Huckle and the gang on a mystery.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is sliding up and down on the Jungle Jims new slide. He invites Parrot to come join him but apparently Parrot is afraid of sliding. Mole appears and tells them how the otters love sliding down to the water and they decide to fly to the lake to meet Otter... when they get there they watch how a first a bit stressed baby Otter learns how to swim.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: As Norman leaves the house, the giant hat he made for the Pontypandy Hat Parade gets stuck in the door, just as the sitting room goes up in flames!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman films a glimpse of the Pontypandyness Monster using Joe Sparkes Submaster 2000, sparking Monster Mania in Pontypandy.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s family trip to the zoo is canceled when it starts raining. In Mimiloo, Kate and Mim-Mim help their pals make their own zoo animals out of bushes and hedges. But after a spritz, the animals come alive, and things quickly get a little too wild!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate needs to find four purple buttons for plushy Mim-Mim’s new sweater, but there are so many to look through, it’s going to take a long time. In Mimiloo, Gobble uses Tack’s Copy-Zapper to duplicate popper peach trees so he can make the biggest batch of popper peach jam ever. But things get messy when Boomer duplicates himself!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi gets a surprise when he finds out there’s a second donkey in the hamlet - a female donkey by the name of Cuddles. He and she hit it off immediately, so when Benedicte suggests they take the two donkeys for a walk in the forest, T’choupi and Nina are overjoyed! Only problem is, T’choupi pampers Cuddles so much that she keeps refusing to budge throughout the whole walk: she’d rather stop and chew on the “treats” along the way!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is feeling a bit grumpy. He’s even refusing to play with Nina: our little hero is missing his grandparents and friends back home. But Mom reassures him: it’s normal to sometimes feel a little down when you’re away your loved - ones. To cheer him up, Dad suggests they make changes to the cottage, to remind him of his house back home, and his family! Tchoupi suddenly switches from feeling sad to feeling ecstatic! He’s eager to invite Nina to celebrate this happy day with him… but can’t find her anywhere! This gets him worrying: what if his friend took off because of how unkind he was to her this morning?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda has invited her friends for Christmas, but a heavy snowfall prevents them from arriving. Luckily, Gertrude the mole digs a tunnel to Tilda’s house, ensuring the party can take place!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Its Grandfathers birthday! The Triplets want to give him an amazing present, Girl wants to offer him a rake for his garden, Poet a big hat and Turbulent wants to bought a race car. Unfortunately and despite their willingness, the Triplets dont have enough money! On Mommys good advice, they decide to team up to buy Grandfather the most amazing gift. Their choice goes for a beautiful tie which they buy and wrap up. Everything is ready for Grandfathers birthday, but thats without counting on Totos appetite.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: At dinnertime, Mommy announces to the Triplets there is a new neighbor in the building. She asks them to go welcoming her and invite her for coffee. However, Madam Gzell, the neighbor, is absolutely not a nice person. She welcomes the Triplets really harshly, all she worries about is her sick baby. When they learn there is a new baby in the building, all the Triplets want, its to play with him. But Madam Gzell is really mysterious, no one can see her baby! The investigation is on !

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Today, everybody seems to be squabbling: Edmund and Margaret, Biva and Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy! Nothing serious really, if you apologize. But as Scoutbadger and Woodsy obstinately refuse to do so, their fight becomes unbearable for their sister Berry.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou gets his first loose tooth and prepares for a visit from the Tooth Fairy!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Daddy helps Caillou prepare magic tricks for the school talent show!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The Troublesome Trucks are being particularly cheeky and disobedient. When a new brake van called Bradford arrives from The Mainland Thomas is delighted to work with him as Bradford is excellent at keeping The Troublesome Trucks under control. But Bradford is a real stickler for the rules, and Thomas soon tires of his petty regulations, which are always making him late.. Eventually Thomas is so fed up with Bradford that he decides to go off without a brake van, a reckless and dangerous move, which ends up with Thomas hurtling out of control down Gordon’s Hill with no brake van to stop him.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot do a good deed to help Wilson so Vee rewards them with a gold wheel. But they get greedy and want another and go about it all the wrong way.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Wilson revels in being Frostini’s special helper and is put out when Hoot and Toot get a chance to assist too. Wilson tries to do everything himself with disastrous consequences.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Today, its sports day! Charley is enthusiastic. Especially when faced with a brand new obstacle: a rock-climbing wall! But over-confident, Charley slips and almost falls... Hes now panicking at the thought of climbing again. That evening at home, Mamie, touched by his plight, lends him a precious pebble that makes him strong! All it takes to help Charley regain his self-confidence.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave learn different ways to stay safe. Hatty shows them how to be safe when crossing a road, boating and doing construction work. Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help keep others safe too, when they repair a broken road sign to warn the Sheep about danger on the road up ahead!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What animal is as graceful as a dancer ? Doodleboo and Sketchy explain how to draw a Flamingo.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers take a baby smooth-coated otter to the rainforest to find its home. Unfortunately, a group of hungry crocodiles have their eyes on the little otter.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a spring day, Alfonso finds an unknown seedling by the stream. The cricket carefully guards the plant, which soon produces a special flower. Alfonso waters and tends to it daily, happily watching it grow. One morning at the end of summer, Alfonso notices that the flower has wilted and its petals have fallen off. Sadly, he gathers the petals and brings them into the house. In the afternoon, Dolly visits him, and later his friends come over to cheer him up. They bring delicious pancakes, but Alfonso is still sad. They go out to the stream, and Alfonso scatters the flower petals into the water, bidding them farewell with tears.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: As the end of summer approaches, the Lightning Beetle visits the fireflies and surprises them with a new book about planets and stars. After a conversation, one little firefly, when the others were already asleep, sets out to conquer the sky, but becomes completely exhausted and crashes. Doctor Owl diagnoses him with a fever and possible pneumonia, so he stays with him to heal. The other fireflies decide to surprise him. With the help of Berry, Dolly, Balthazar, Stanley, Flutter, and Eddy, they make colourful orbs, and the Lightning Beetle crafts the Sun. They suspend the planets on a hoop, which Eddy rotates with a contraption. They also instal tiny lights, resembling stars.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide And Seek at the crèche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesn’t go to the toilet with all the others before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding place or try and hold on.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are making ginger bunny biscuits for Charlie and Coco.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are having so much fun playing together, they dont want to say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bing accidentally leaves his Hoppity Voosh toy at the park, Amma helps Bing focus and retrace his steps to find it.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Berrykin Blooms braggart cousin, Berrykin Bertram, has won the hot sauce competition at the local county fair year after year. But this year, Sour and Apple are determined to help the kindhearted Bloom win... whether he wants to or not!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Margaret is teaching orienteering to the children. And to put into practice what they have just learned, she has organized an orienteering course, to be played in teams. Scoutbadger, Rosie and Pico are in the same team, the red one. The badger isn’t happy about being with Pico, whom he believes to be too slow and a little wimpy. Scoutbadger is in it to win it! In his eyes, anorienteering course is a race.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends watch slides and then play a lively game of shadow puppets. They continue the game in front of a rock wall, forming funny shapes. Bubble, the little rose beetle, gets scared by the strange shadows on the wall, thinking a giant monster has moved into the forest. Luckily, Christopher, the canary, helps clarify the misunderstanding. Bubble and Christopher join the fun shadow play.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia realizes that, despite her efforts to fit in, she will never share all the memories the children have made living in the Mouse Mansion. Sam will help her overcome this difficulty.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia dream of seeing snow falling in the yard of the Mouse Mansion. They decide to do everything they can to make this happen. But such a thing is not so simple, as they will find out!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: On the beach, the Triplets are playing with Mommy’s bag, she scolds them nicely and tells them it’s time to go home ! But when she reaches for the keys, they are not here anymore ! They probably fell off the bag when the Triplets were playing with it. They have to find the keys or therwise everyone will have to sleep on the beach tonight - which by the way, sound good to the Triplets. Maybe raking the beach could be useful? Or then metal detectors, which would allow to find all the keys of the beach.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are watching a movie on television, when Poet starts to ask Mommy How do you make a movie ?, she answers him that you need actors band a director to lead them and make the movie. Poet is very excited, when he’s a grown up, he wants to be a director and make animal documentaries. But his brother and sister do not agree with that, they want Poet to film them doing stunt, in a castle, with Dragons and sleeping beauties. Poor Poet will have to comply with the tantrums of his actors, not easy to do movies.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Rattling rivets! The Spooky Chugger has returned!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: As Norman leaves the house, the giant hat he made for the Pontypandy Hat Parade gets stuck in the door, just as the sitting room goes up in flames!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Sarah, James and Bronwyn find a wishing well in the woods, they are so busy making wishes that they do not notice that Lion the cat has fallen in! The next day Lion still hasnt turned up, so Sarah and Bronwyn go back to wish for their cats return and hear a miaow, but how can they get Lion out? Once more, its Sam to the rescue.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate And Mim Mim

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Enchanted by its hopping, Kate captures a grasshopper, but as soon as it’s in the jar, it stands still. In Mimiloo, Kate and Mim-Mim help Lily try to capture some amazing new Mimiloo critters to learn all about them. The mysterious, playful creatures lead them on a wild chase, but when they’re captured, they turn out to be super shy!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou wants to be like a real rockstar, but his loud tunes keep disturbing his family. He goes into a rockstar fantasy, where he learns that he doesn’t need to play loudly to make an impact, and finds a new way to rock out – by turning his rock song into a lullaby for Rosie.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: At the park to watch a meteor shower, Caillou is surprised to see a new girl, Tina. Suddenly feeling shy, Caillou pretends to be the fearless Dax Turbo Space Captain who makes first contact with the alien, Shyanne (Tina). This helps Caillou overcome his shyness and make a new space-loving friend.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Its the hottest day of the year on Sodor and the sun is causing the tracks to buckle and bend. Dowager Hatt, arrives with a present for the Fat Controller - a white pith helmet to protect him from the sun explaining that white reflects heat. Meanwhile the buckled tracks cause Whiff to lose some rubbish from his trucks and a dropped bottle causes a fire. When Belle and Flynn come to the rescue, Belle is derailed and Flynn must travel on his road wheels to put out the fire. The buckled tracks are finally repaired and Thomas suggests that they paint the new tracks white (like Sir Tophams hat) which will reflect the sun and hopefully stop the tracks buckling again.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: It’s a tough game of hide and seek between the Mimic Octopus and the rangers. After all, it’s the master of disguise...

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Can the Junior Rangers train a timid Caracal to be independent in the wild?

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat and Jess have a special delivery for Mrs Goggins - a Loch Ness Monster locator!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Micawbers claws need clipping and Pat needs to deliver the claw clippers and Amy the vet.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald tries to teach Daisy the piano. Daisy is very keen, but it just doesn’t sound the same as when Oswald plays, so they decide that Daisy might be more suited to another instrument. They go to Bingo’s music shop where there are instruments of every kind; flutes, cellos, basses, banjos – you name it Bingo has it. After trying practically every instrument in the shop and becoming increasingly disappointed, Daisy notices Weenie bouncing up and down on some bongo drums. That’s it! Daisy is a natural with the bongos and they all end up playing together in Big Park.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald invites Henry and Daisy round for afternoon tea. Unfortunately, Henry always has three marshmallows with his cocoa and only two are left. Oswald sets off with his umbrella to buy another from Andy’s Candy Store. As he heads back to his apartment, a huge gust of wind whisks him up high into the sky, giving him a bird’s eye view of Big City. After much delay, Oswald eventually arrives home only to find everyone has finished their tea. Henry tells him that from now on he will have his cocoa with only two marshmallows – no more, no less!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Roland’s Gifts is an internet gift shop; Bob, Leo, Scoop, Muck and Lofty are in its huge distrubution warehouse with owner, Roland Sweet. It’s a few days before Christmas and Roland has commissioned Bob and his team to install a hi-tech a robotic picking system, which will pick items off shelving, wrap them and put them into delivery vans via a chute. The system needs to be installed by evening the next day so customers receive their gifts in time for Christmas Day. Scoop and Muck are excited and do ‘robotic’ impressions; Leo claims to be very knowledgeable about robotics. During the installation Leo switches the system on to prove his knowledge to Scoop. Meanwhile an approaching snowstorm has moved the delivery deadline to that very evening.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are preparing to dig the foundations for a skyscraper in Spring City’s new business zone and are under pressure from Mayor Madison to get started. She keeps interrupting their work on Bob’s smart-phone. Scoop and Muck set a challenge to see which of them can dig/clear the earth quickest. Interrupted again, Bob calls a halt but the machines get carried away and keep digging. Scoop goes too deep and hits into something hard underground. Bob calls Anish Bose, the archaeologist, who announces the discovery of Roman ruins. The build will have to halt while they excavate the site. Scoop is filled with remorse and horrified to learn that Romans didn’t have machines like him. An interested crowd starts to gather as Anish discovers more artefacts. Mr Bentley arrives for a progress report but rather than being angry at the lack of progress he is excited by the historic discovery.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse see a beautiful rainbow. When it disappears before Big Nutbrown Hare can see it, they recreate it for him with flowers.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse and Little Nutbrown Hare’s favourite tree falls over in a summer storm. Theyre sad until they discover the fallen tree provides an exciting new place to explore.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are inspired to make a spider’s web, but run into all sorts of comic trouble when they do.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy loves driving his new go-kart but he has to drive safely. Help him learn when to stop and when to go.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Mr Frumble’s morning newspaper disappears off his front step, Huckle sets out to investigate what happened to it. After a number of other innocuous items ‘disappear’ from across town, Huckle ultimately discovers that the culprits are none other than Pig Will and Pig Won’t. They are enthusiastically taking part in Busytown’s Annual Recycling Drive by picking up anything they see that can be recycled./Huckle, Lowly and Sally happen upon a huge tooth and can’t imagine anyone in all of Busytown big enough to own it.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy finds a grey sticky thing that looks like a net in the corner of his bathroom. But what is it - he goes to Okido to find out! He lands in Zoe and Felix’s garden to find them doing some paper gluing to make a picture. Zoe’s communicator rings and Zam tells her that there’s an emergency at Loopy Bridge and she needs their help! When they arrive they see that there’s a crack in Loopy Bridge! Zam says she could fix it but she’s run out of glue… Felix offers his paper glue to her, but she tells him that it won’t be sticky enough, and she needs a special glue.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is spinning himself around and around in circles across the sitting room… just for fun of course! He loses balance and topples over. Messy sits up and wonders why his windmill came to a dizzy end? He magically transports himself to Okido to find out! In Okido, Zoe and Felix are practising ballet so Messy bounces in to show off his best monster moves until they’re interrupted by the sound of Zoe’s communicator – its Zim calling! They’re invited to help Zim, Zam and Zoom at Magneto Zone.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Sour teasing Apple escalates into a prank war between the two of them. After the girls feud disrupts the town, they are sentenced in a Berry Bitty City-style trial to camp alone together for a whole weekend. Miraculously, they emerge best buds, and their friends are relieved, until Sours influence on Apple turns her into a mini-Sour, and they have to do a personality makeover on Apple.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry has a cold but gets bored of staying in bed so decides to go and play in Dino world.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: A preschool boy named Harry receives a bucket full of toy dinosaurs. This bucket holds a secret --- by using its power, Harry can travel with his dinosaurs to an amazing land of imagination called Dino World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden explores a North American beach with a walking stick, encountering seals, and discovering a blind pup. Leo,Katie and Hero are playing Blind Mans Bluff in the Garden before getting a call from Jayden regarding the pup. From the computer, they learn about harbor seals and realize the pup may be lost since the mother is nowhere to be seen on the beach. Leo, Katie and Hero travel to the beach, where confusion arises about the pups behavior. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey as she clarifies the seal pups natural behavior, and Ranger Rocky suggests the mother might be finding food in the ocean. After the call with Ranger Joey, they can’t seem to find the pup! Concerned about the missing pup and Hero, the group splits up to search and eventually finds Hero playing Blind Man’s Bluff with the seal. Ranger Rocky surprises them as he shows them who he found, the pup’s mother returning from the ocean! Leo concludes the mission accomplished before joining Katie and Hero in another round of Blind Man’s Bluff.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Its Darcy to the rescue when Monty falls down an old mine shaft while working on the new visitors park.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas loses his voice trying to sing opera like his Italian friends, and tries to find a new way to pass on a very important message

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The film director Ratatino is filming a report on firefighters when he sprains his wrist. Grisu then accepts the mission of being a cameraman in Ratatinos stead. The young dragon is very excited first as he gets to shoot his favorite subject: firefighters at work. But his task soon gets difficult as Ratatinos wanting action, action and more action causes bumping and falling and flame throwing and other comic mishaps. At some point Ratatino gets Grisu so upset that he breathes fire and destroy the cameras memory card. Fortunately theres another one left and Grisu goes film a real rescue at the farm and manages to shoot awesome images

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: When Mr Guellec loses all his wild pineapple seeds in a fire, Grisu decides to go to the jungle with Dr Natureza to get new ones, and thus save Mr Guellecs crop. Once there, Natureza gets attacked by mosquitos and Grisu has to complete the mission all by himself.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Autumn day Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse convince Little Grey Squirrel to leave his pile of spotted acorns unattended, so they can all play with the crunchy leaves. While they’re gone Little Redwood Fox discovers the yummy acorns and takes them home. Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson is trying for his Fire Warden badge and is thrilled to be given his own siren. When the fire alarm goes off, he must sound his siren and make sure everybody leaves the area safely. Wilson gets a little carried away practising and doesn’t hear when the real alarm goes off. He is given another chance and this time concentrates and takes his responsibilities very seriously. When the alarm goes off during the night, he is able to evacuate the chuggers from the roundhouses quickly and calmly.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie and Biva have found a superb burrow that Rosie’s father could use when he visits the area. The only problem is that Scoutbadger and Woodsy have also discovered it and Scoutbadger would like to make it into a games room.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and the team are asked to build a set for movie-star Dash Lightning’s new film, Muck thinks that his dreams have come true. Dash Lightning is Mucks’ hero, so he decides that he wants to meet him whilst working at Spring City Studios. But when Muck gets distracted with trying to find his hero, he doesn’t pay attention to any of the jobs he is doing. On racing to meet his hero, Muck clips the set’s backdrop and he doesn’t wait to check the pyrotechnic lights, causing them to fall towards the studio-lighting crane. Just as the director calls action, the set falls apart and the pyrotechnics explode towards the lights, risking a fire.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Jenny Dobbs commissions Bob and team to build Komodo Island with a walkway/bridge for the public to gain a better view of the Komodo Dragons. Muck discovers he is terrified of the Komodos so is set to work clearing out their old enclosure (without his knowledge) instead. When he discovers some eggs buried in the earth there he braves returning to the Island to ask Jenny what to do with them. But a Komodo hisses at him and Muck is spooked - he backs into part of the walkway causing it to collapse and leaving Leo dangling in mid air from a safety harness. When Muck sees the Komodo apparently climbing the tree to attack Leo he overcomes his fears to go back and save him.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When a new nameplate is about to be placed on the statue of Admiral Hornblast, it suddenly disappears. Huckle, Sally and Lowly check out the photos and videos taken at the scene and ultimately determine that the statue slide over the plate when it was bumped by an out of control bulldozer./Pig Will and Pig Won’t are playing spies. However Pig Won’t suddenly finds himself out of the game when his Secret Spy Ring disappears!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A yellow-crested cockatoo joins Leo and Hero’s game of musical statues. After learning more about the bird, the Junior Rangers travel to the rainforest to take it home.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Katie finds out that a big fish in the garden pond is a whitespotted bamboo shark. The Junior Rangers sail to the Pacific Ocean to find a coral reef for the bamboo shark to live in.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard make Milou a pair of boots to go outside in the snow but Milou runs off! Putting boots in a cat is no easy task, but Daddy has a better idea to help Milou get around in the snow.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon after a heavy storm Leapy, the grasshopper found an injured stranger, He immediately called for help. Berry and Dolly arrived in no time as always.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly are planting sunflowers on a spring day. They take care of the flowers carefully as they emerge from the ground and grow tall. The two friends are very happy. Unfortunately the joy does not last long; someone damaged the flowers.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: There will be a puppet show in the middle of the forest. Berry, Dolly, Balthazar and Eddy also get going to watch the show. Eddy and Balthazar had a fight over a pebble when Eddy, the potato beetle, felt down. Oh my!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One day, Egon happily played with his new black scooter. The others also wants to try it but Egon not in the mood for sharing at all!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert teaches the kids how to find one’s way through the forest. But as they search their way home, Rupert falls asleep. The kids follow their tracks and also help Rupert find his way back.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Mole Max thinks his son Karl is too young to go camping with the other kids. Tilda changes Max’s mind and Karl happily joins the trip. He feels insecure until he helps Tilda in an emergency.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Ida asks Molly, if she can look after her duckling Alina. But today of all days, Alina wants to learn how to fly and gets herself in some risky situations – and so Molly has to take some risks too.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. All his friends admire the interesting little creature and he feels very special indeed. When she eventually flies away Little Nutbrown Hare follows her, wanting her back. But he understands why she left when he discovers she has lots of tiny spotty babies.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It is a sunny Spring day in the meadow and Little Nutbrown Hare is enjoying all it has to offer. As the day wears on a heavy grey cloud forces Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse to seek shelter from the rain. Will the friends let a little water ruin their fun or will they discover that rainy days can be just as exciting.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. He’s convinced that ants are not very nice, and only after Big Nutbrown Hare explains how the ants were probably taking the berries home to their families does Little Nutbrown Hare forgive them. And when he sees how clever the ants are, he soon wants to be like them.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: The whole family is going canoeing, and to make things even more exciting, theres going to be a race - Gaspard and Mummys boat against Simon and Daddys boat!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers go to the rainforest to find a new home for a goliath birdeater spider. But can the Junior Rangers scare off a pair of weasels who are preying on their eight-legged friend?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson already knows how to honk, but Emery is testing him to make sure he knows when to honk. Wilson gets a bit mixed up and fails his first attempt – but when he encounters a broken signal light at a tunnel entrance, his honking saves the day! Since he’s proved he knows how to use his horn correctly in an emergency, he wins his badge after all.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees have to do safety checks before making a long journey. Koko wants to reach the destination first – so when she mistakenly thinks Brewster has raced ahead, she doesn’t bother to top up her coolant. She goes faster and faster trying to catch up until she overheats and stalls. She may not have earned her badge this time, but she’s learned a very important lesson – never skimp on preparation!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina and Dad have fun imitating birdsongs and are very good at it. Tchoupi, however, is totally unable to join in: singing like a bird isn’t his forte! Frustrated, he suggests they play hide And seek in the forest instead. Nina’s fine with it… as long as they do a special kind of hide And seek, using birdsongs to find each other! T’choupi opts for the simplest song of all: a cuckoo, with its characteristic kookoo greeting: Kookoo, kookoo!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This lunchtime, T’choupi refuses to eat the fish Dad has cooked, supposedly because it doesn’t look tasty. But Mom insists: T’choupi can’t say he doesn’t like it if he hasn’t even tried it! So, when his parents aren’t looking, T’choupi slips his piece of fish to Ciboulette the cat, who just happens to be passing by at that moment. There we are – no-one’s any the wiser, mumbles T’choupi with a sigh of relief. But when, a short time later, he notices poor little Ciboulette has a strange cough, he gets worried: did the fish he gave her to eat give her a stomach ache??!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina finds T’choupi’s baby sister Fanni so cute that she suggests they go out and find other babies, in the hamlet. Launching a baby quest, she and T’choupi come across a chick, a baby rabbit, a caterpillar and a little snail! Next, they head to the woods to find more babies. But T’choupi suddenly gapes as he spots the cutest young animal of them all: a baby hedgehog, also known as a hoglet.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley, Lily and Louis discover the game of croquet with Anna. But Louis isnt very good and keeps missing. So he deliberately plays as soon as his friends turn their backs. And just like magic, he succeeds in all his shots! Not fooled, Charley begins to have strong suspicions: what if Louis... was cheating!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia find the boisterous Tonio frozen like a statue, in the yard, when he was supposed to bring them a snack! And he doesnt talk anymore, even though hes usually a real chatterbox...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has a very bad night. He only finds sleep when he lies down on the floor in the morning. Julia finds him there and tries to understand how to get Sam back to sleeping well, in his own bed.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas and Diesel are sent to collect trucks from the Ffarquhar Quarry, they argue about who should be the back engine. But then Diesel suggests he take the trucks with Mavis and leave Thomas to look after the quarry until they get back. When they don’t come back, Thomas gets fed up and decides to take another load of troublesome trucks on his own and then there is trouble!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is on his branch line when a passenger pulls the emergency cable and he has to stop quickly. But it turns out not to be an emergency at all, but a bird watcher who’s spotted a rare bird. To make matters worse, Clarabel has a wheel flat after being dragged along with her brakes on. So the next time Thomas sees the bird watcher he refuses to stop to collect him, but he soon learns that that’s not the right thing to do either.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou chooses a new adventure to read using his free book voucher!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: When Caillou tries out some of Leos prank toys, his family is in for a surprise!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Peppino delivers pizzas faster than anyone in Busytown, so when the kids wait an unusually long time for their pizza to arrive, they figure something must be wrong at the pizzeria. But Peppino isnt there and neither is his delivery car. By following his delivery route, the kids ultimately find Peppino stuck in an elevator./‘Fairy dust’ and strange sightings has Hilda Hippo convinced there are real live fairies in Busytown Woods!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey loves looking clean; he admires his reflection in the lake when all of a sudden mud flies over to his direction. Can it be? It sure can, that is, if you have a Hippo friend next to you…when Hippo comes to shore, Monkey must play with him his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: In the hot savanna it is hard to find some shade, monkey thought he found the perfect place when this “place” started to move…. Turns out to be his friend the Camel whos all ready to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Wildmen of Pontypandy are trying to carry a massive log through the woods. But when Moose tries to lighten their load by floating the log in the river, he gets swept up and dragged downstream towards the waterfall!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Dilys takes her eye off the stove for a split second, the Cut Price Store catches on fire, trapping Norman upstairs!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin and Bear do everything they can to try and stay up all night to catch a late broadcast of the Submarine Rescue Guys radio show. It’s tough going, especially when they are not working together -- but once they join forces, instead of working against each other, they find the challenge way more fun. Even if they are too sleepy to stay awake for the whole show... / While taking care of Mr. Groundhog’s garden, Franklin and Bear discover that they have some clever adversaries – a flock of hungry crows. Mr. Turtle helps Franklin see that there’s more than one way to scare off a crow.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Today, everybody seems to be squabbling: Edmund and Margaret, Biva and Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy! Nothing serious really, if you apologize. But as Scoutbadger and Woodsy obstinately refuse to do so, their fight becomes unbearable for their sister Berry.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is looking for the perfect gift for Mothers Day! He can count on Doodleboo to have a good idea...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky dreams of going to the shooting stars night. But there will be a lot of people and Sketcky wants to get the best spot. Doodleboo knows exactly what he would need to arrive first tonight...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Bubble would like to see a new decoration in the jar and Doodleboo knows perfectly how to embellish it!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave report all the big stories in the Jungle for the ‘Daily Banana’ newspaper. Hatty helps them ask all the right questions, so their reports include everything their readers need to know about Larry the Leopard’s amazing rescue, a Parrot’s first ever ‘loop-the-loop’ and Bobby the Monkey’s record-breaking weight lifting victory!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave follow recipes to make their favourite fruit and vegetable juice drinks. They collect the fresh ingredients from Hatty’s garden and count out the quantities of each one needed to make A Ruff-Ruff Super Juice, Tweet’s Sweet Treat and Dave’s Bubbly Banana Juice. Then it’s into Hatty’s Bubble-Juicer they go, for some juicing magic!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The cool Autumn breeze isn’t enough to deter Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse from going out to find what special experiences the day might bring. However, with the weather and wind constantly changing, it’s very hard for the friends continue playing any one game. Will the strange weather spoil their fun, or will it bring them a special experience after all?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One bright moonlit Autumn night, the Nutbrown Hares are both having trouble sleeping. As they lay quietly in a pile of leaves they listen to the sounds of the night… swish, hoot, wobble, nibble, croak and splash! They go on a journey to discover what’s making the interesting night noises, but will they work out what sound the moon makes?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you break a special thing, you can put it in the bye-bye box and it keeps it safe.Bing is having fun with a new orange balloon when he jumps on it and breaks it. Bing is upset because he broke his balloon, so Flop helps him place the recovered pieces in the bye-bye box, which contains irreparable objects that are too valuable to throw away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is on the swing in the park when Pando arrives and wants to have a go too. They agree to let each other have turns by counting up to ten, but Pando wont count properly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bing and Sula feed the ducks in the park, Sula stands quietly but Bing is boisterous.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing so Flop suggests they make a smoothie. When Bings carrot accidentally gets put in the blender, hes upset to disover he cant have it back.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: During a big storm, lightning strikes the lookout tower, setting it ablaze. Berry, Dolly, and their friends immediately alert the firefighter beetles. The brave firefighters arrive quickly, extinguish the fire, and save the tower from greater damage. The little team works together to repair the roof, and Eddy installs a lightning rod to make the tower safer. At the end of the day, everyone thanks the heroic fire beetles.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends watch slides and then play a lively game of shadow puppets. They continue the game in front of a rock wall, forming funny shapes. Bubble, the little rose beetle, gets scared by the strange shadows on the wall, thinking a giant monster has moved into the forest. Luckily, Christopher, the canary, helps clarify the misunderstanding. Bubble and Christopher join the fun shadow play.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Eddy, the potato beetle, notices he cant see well from a distance, so on Dollys advice, he visits Dr. Owl. Eddy needs glasses, so he and Dolly visit Fly Flynn, the optician. Eddy is delighted to rediscover the joy of sharp vision and can finally see the birds lively concert clearly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble is peacefully resting in the meadow when a bored cloud playfully pours rain on him, making the rose beetle angry. When Bubble tries to catch the cloud, he gets hurt. The cloud regrets its prank and apologizes. To make amends, it offers to fly Bubble over the forest, who happily waves to his friends from above. By the end of the adventure, the cloud and Bubble become good friends.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and the gang race all over Busytown trying to find the lock that fits and old key they found. They search everywhere from the Busytown Museum to Mr Gronkle’s antiques. They come up empty until they remember that an old roll top desk was being delivered to the antique store near where they found the key and had a lock on it. They try the key and it fits. / Chocolate sauce on Lowlys car leaves Huckle and the gang puzzled.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is giving a sportscaster-like monologue as he kicks coconuts thru his makeshift goal... Parrot suggests that monkey should make a goal net... Mole then appears and tells them about spiders renowned webbing. When they find spider they are amazed by her webbing and invite her to a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman is making a movie about a young wizard called Wally Wizzo, but while filming he finds himself in need of rescuing more that once.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Charlie takes Sarah, Mandy and Norman out to sea. But the kids tussle over who should be captain until Charlie is knocked into the sea and Norman causes the engine to catch fire.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate is looking for fireflies, but they keep flying away without lighting up. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and the Sniffer Finder, a rambunctious robot dog, help Lily look for her favourite magical animal, a unicorn, by tracking its favourite food—shimmer flowers! When every patch of flowers they find has already been eaten, it’s up to Kate to discover why.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s too small to carry flower pots and can’t help her parents. In Mimiloo, Tack’s shrinking violet petals fly all over Kate and Mim-Mim, shrinking them to insect-size! To return to regular size, they must traverse the vast jungle of Gobble’s garden. It’s a daunting journey, until they meet Tiny, a teeny little ant who can do big things!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and his family arrive at the hamlet for their first day of vacation. Having been told by his parents that their stay will be packed with surprises, T’choupi has high expectations! But disappointment sets in fast: not only does he find the dog daunting, he also notices there’s no slide, or TV, or pool! This place is going to be sooo boring!!... Until he finds out there’s a girl his age living there. Huh, where?! T’choupi can’t wait to meet this mysterious potential playmate!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Dad sends Tchoupi and Nina out on a mission: to go to the vegetable garden and find the veggies he needs to make a nice mixed salad! The kids are delighted… until they discover that the tomatoes - the main ingredient for Dad’s salad - are green instead of red! Nina comes up with a solution she heard about from her mom: music!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have been given a great number of cheese star by Mrs Brioche. But Tony and Ella think they should share it with them. M. Grumpy decide to organize a game to bring peace back.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One morning, Molly knocks excitedly on Tildas door: theres going to be a knitting competition in the village. Tilda and Molly at once set off to the village shop to buy some wool. All the other inhabitants of Wild Rose Lane are also buying knitting materials. The competition makes rivals of the friends and they work alone, quietly and secretly.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are at the beach, and they can’t wait to go swimming!!! Unfortunately, there is a new lifeguard on the beach, and he is not the kind to let anyone have fun... The Triplets can’t either bathe, or make sandcastles, or pirouettes, or kite. What a bummer! The lifeguard whistles constantly, like a quartermaster sergeant against his soldiers. Then the Triplets are going to k really hard to escape the lifeguard and give him the hardest time, who will win this fight?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Be friend with a shark, is that even possible? Poet discovers a swimming ring shaped like a shark in the sand. He imagines being friend with a NICE shark which is tired of everyone thinking he’s bad. Turbulent and Girl take him out of his musing and ask him if he wants to join them to fish shrimps. But Poet won’t fish shrimps, no! He will find a shark and make him his new friend. He’ll bring it back to Paris where he will play with it, feed it, learn it how to brush teeth and bed it. Not sure Mommy will agree.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As the snow and the cold have settled outside, the Fox-Badger family must remain within the warmth of the burrow. A blessing for the four practically hibernating badgers who spend their time yawning and napping! As for Rosie, she hates staying indoors: the little vixen needs to spend her excess energy!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his family visit the botanical gardens, and Caillou uses his listening skills to get through a maze!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou has fun at Rosies birthday party playing games and giving her a special birthday present!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Samson boasts proudly that he has been given a very special job taking stone from the quarry to the docks. But when he learns that Thomas has been given the same job he tries to find another way to prove how important he is. So he decides to take much more trucks than he should insisting that this will save time. But with so many heavy trucks Samson can’t get over Gordon’s Hill. So it takes even longer and when he asks Thomas to help him, he ends up making Thomas late too. The Fat Controller is not happy, but Samson insists that he’s learned his lesson and won’t make the same mistake again…

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Hodge breaks down and has to think on his wheels to find a way to alert the other chuggers so he doesn’t miss the rolling stock show he’s been so excited to get to.

programme.title: Chuggington 0
programme.desc: The trainees are doing their advanced safari training to learn how to get closer to the animals. But Wilson camouflages himself as a parrot and scares them all!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley, Lily and Louis discover the game of croquet with Anna. But Louis isnt very good and keeps missing. So he deliberately plays as soon as his friends turn their backs. And just like magic, he succeeds in all his shots! Not fooled, Charley begins to have strong suspicions: what if Louis... was cheating!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty shows Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave how to take perfect photographs of Speedy Sheep, Sneezy Sheep and Little Lamb for their aunt’s photo album. But there’s so much to remember to get that perfect shot: make sure your subject is happy and smiling, frame your picture with the subject in the centre, don’t cover the lens and hold your camera steady to avoid getting blurry images!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What costume Sketchy really wants to wear? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Super Hero.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a playful young orangutan in his garden. With the orangutan in tow, the Junior Rangers travel to the Indonesian island of Sumatra to look for the orangutan’s mother.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry wants to perform magic, but Stanley and Balthazar tease him. Berry borrows Katies magic box, learns tricks, and puts on a show for his friends. The tricks amaze the audience, especially when Berry successfully performs real magic by summoning rain.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The little friends decide to get rid of their old, unwanted items and organize a yard sale in the meadow. The old items lead to a lively barter, but a large pile of useless junk remains. The rubbishtruck of the quick beetles arrives to help, taking away the remaining items and assisting in cleaning the meadow.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble catches a cold, and Dr. Owl suggests drinking elderflower tea. Flutter sets out to gather elderflowers and meets Harmony, the glass-winged butterfly. Harmony teaches Flutter how to make the tea properly. Thanks to the delicious drink, Bubble soon recovers, and they celebrate spring with their new friend Harmony over a tasty elderflower syrup.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, finds a strange little fish in the stream, which turns out to be a lost polliwog. Although Alfonso is sad when the polliwog returns to its frog family, their friendship doesnt end. Alfonso visits his tadpole friend every day, who soon develops into a real little frog.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: During a big storm, lightning strikes the lookout tower, setting it ablaze. Berry, Dolly, and their friends immediately alert the firefighter beetles. The brave firefighters arrive quickly, extinguish the fire, and save the tower from greater damage. The little team works together to repair the roof, and Eddy installs a lightning rod to make the tower safer. At the end of the day, everyone thanks the heroic fire beetles.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula invent a noisy game with a helium balloon they find stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. But there is only one crown and both need it to complete their outfits. When the crown gets broken Flop helps them to make new crowns out of the broken pieces.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, something special they can all do and Bing gets frustrated when his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When Apple feels left out of a Berryball game and an advanced ballet class, she invents some “groove booties” programmed to dance to any beat. She temporarily impresses her friends with her dance moves, but when the groove booties go out of control and threaten the towns Berryball game, she is forced to fess up.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmund falls on the floor during the burrows big springcleaning. Nothing serious fortunately, but he needs to rest and take a day off. But he neither has time nor is used to rest! As ld get worse if he doesn’t keep his anklestill all day, Berry, Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy do their best to make sure that their father rests without getting bored.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Eddy, the potato beetle, notices he cant see well from a distance, so on Dollys advice, he visits Dr. Owl. Eddy needs glasses, so he and Dolly visit Fly Flynn, the optician. Eddy is delighted to rediscover the joy of sharp vision and can finally see the birds lively concert clearly.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Tonight there is a children show for the parents. Julia planned a scooter act with Sam. But Sam doesnt dare to tell her he is very bad on those wheels. How long can he avoid to tell her the truth?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: When the Triplets are going to the beach, Turbulent offers to carry the umbrella but it seems too heavy for him and Mommy asks him if he wants help. But no ! « I am strong » answers Turbulent. Then comes the lifeguard to help them, he is super strong with giant muscles and Turbulent is very impressed. Plus, the lifeguard has won the Mister Beach competition. It’s decided, Turbulent will do exactly the same. He decides to start exercising, doing a lot of push ups and weightlifting. But sport is really hard. And Turbulent would rather play with his brother and sister.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are having fun in the park with Toto when the dog suddenly rushes after Mrs Gzells cat, well actually rather after the cookie the cat had in its mouth. He runs like the wind and for the Triplets, Toto is THE Champion. But Mrs Gzell replies that if he’s so strong like they say, he should take part to the dog championship the next day. The Triplets are sure Toto will win everything, the competition of snoring, of barking and even the eating contest. Unfortunately, when the competition begins, those are not the challenges the Triplets were expecting.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: When a thunderstorm comes to Chuggington, Wilson cant control his fear!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah takes a walk along the cliffs to tire out Nipper the dog, but ends up injuring her leg.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Charlie takes Sarah, Mandy and Norman out to sea. But the kids tussle over who should be captain until Charlie is knocked into the sea and Norman causes the engine to catch fire.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: A bird has flown into Kate’s house, and Kate has an idea to get it out—but her parents can’t hear her over the commotion. In Mimiloo, a group of lemmings are in trouble and decide that Mim-Mim is their leader. They ask him to find them a new home—but a soft-spoken little lemming has a great idea herself!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Dad gives Kate a puzzle that seems too hard to solve. In Mimiloo, Mim-Mim finds an enchanted ring that leads everyone on a quest to find the hidden treasure of King Tut-n-Bunny. It leads them to a sphinx which is full of obstacles and challenges that test the gang’s abilities and Mim-Mim’s courage.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou’s over-enthusiasm accidentally scares away the birds on his backyard bird feeder, he jumps into an explorer fantasy where he is pursued by a very enthusiastic but friendly Bigfoot (Mommy) and learns to soften his approach in order to see the birdies up close.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou thinks his snow buddy isnt as good as Sarahs, his feelings of inadequacy inspire an Ace Builder fantasy. Caillou learns that just because something is different, doesnt mean its better or worse, its just different!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day two visitors come to the Island of Sodor to take pictures of interesting engines. At first Bert finds them very polite. They drive their little blue car along the line, racing ahead of him and stop to take pictures as they go past. But they don’t bother waving or saying hello and when they drive through a puddle Bert gets splashed with muddy water and decides they are very rude. He decides to get his own back by using his steam to make water rain down on them from the wet branches, but the Small Controller is not very happy with him.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A Lioness is trapped in a cave! Can the Junior Rangers help reunite her with her pride?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyles ATV is invaded by Echidnas! Can the Junior Rangers help him get his precious vehicle back?

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat and Jess are called to Cardiff to collect a new sorting machine when the Pencaster machine breaks down.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: It’s a snowy day in Greendale, and Ted Glen has invited the kids to his workshop to meet his friend, space expert Professor Farrow. Julian’s excited but so is Pat, who has always yearned to be an astronaut. He’s even more thrilled when he finds that his special delivery is a space suit - an extra surprise for the kids. When his van breaks down in a snowy lane, he finds an ingenious solution - only to suffer a puncture - and Ted is unable to help... Meanwhile, Professor Farrow and Lauren take the kids out into the snow and re-create the surface of the moon. Pat’s determined to make his delivery, but how will he make it on foot through the snow?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely ‘poiky thing’ in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle not realizing it belongs to Pando’s digger.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula collect acorns in the park with Flop, but Bings pile keeps shrinking.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing finds his old baby shoes that are much too small for him now. When the shoes fit baby Charlie perectly, Bing has a hard time letting them go.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald discovers an old polka dot umbrella while walking in Big City Park. Not needing an umbrella on such a hot sunny day, Oswald decides to find its owner, but after asking several people with no luck, Oswald resigns himself to the fact that he should keep it. However, the umbrella comes in very handy as the hot sunny day turns into a very wet and rainy day.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: On a lovely sunny day, Oswald, Weenie, Daisy and Henry decide to go camping. They prepare for the adventure and pack all the things necessary for the trip. Henry doesn’t like the look of the weather and takes no risks, packing everything waterproof from galoshes to umbrellas. They eventually find the perfect spot to pitch the tent when it starts to pour! Henry, delighted at being proved right, starts unpacking his gear, only to see it blown away by the wind. Realising that the trip is a wash out they make their way home and decide to pitch their tent – indoors!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s Christmas time. Bob and the team are building the Spring City Christmas display in the city centre’s plaza. Lofty loves everything Christmas and decorates the yard in snowflakes. Then he sees that Bob’s home doesn’t have any decorations, so he decides to give him the perfect present. Lofty arrives on site, determined to give Bob his Christmas present but when asked to help hang the lights, he puts the present down by the giant display tree. Lofty finishes his work and again tries to give Bob his present but now it’s lost somewhere in the display.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob must finish a Dinosaur Park attraction for the Mayor to visit that evening. This involves creating a trail around which life-sized models of dinosaurs will be positioned, climaxing with a roaring animatronic model of a triceratops. Muck starts to clear the main path. He’s fascinated, but also a little bit scared of dinosaurs. Leo reassures Muck by revealing he too was a bit wary of dinosaurs when he was small, and gets Muck to roar like a dinosaur. The model dinosaurs arrive and are very impressive. Scoop decides to surprise Leo and pushes the triceratops into the middle of the path. Instead of surprising Leo, they spook Muck who panics and knocks the model over a cliff.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse find a strange set of prints in the snow and hunt for the owner, their imaginations run away with them

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. When the full moon is veiled in clouds, Little Nutbrown is disappointed - but is extra delighted when the clouds part to reveal a bright red moon.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are making a train out of lots of different shapes. Can you help them?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Trying to figure out what a strange piece of metal with a number 10 on it is, Huckle and his pals take it to Blacksmith Bear who helps them discover strange writing on it. Figuring it must be a foreign language, they take it to Ms Honey and, with her help, determine the piece of metal is a lost tap from Hilda’s French tap dance shoes./Huckle and pals set out to find the whistle blower who is causing a traffic jam.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is running around in his garden and notices his shadow chasing him and copying everything he does! Trying to figure out how to get rid of it, he goes to Okido. When he arrives, his shadow has followed him and then he spots more shadows on the side of Felix and Zoe’s house. He looks up to find his friends on the balcony of their treehouse, making shadow puppets. He bounces up to join them and then all of a sudden the shadows disappear…

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is hiding in a tent made of cushions, pretending not to be scared of the storm outside! He wonders why the sky is flashing and being so noisy! So he spins to Okido to find the answer. When Messy arrives, Zoe and Felix are lounging, warm and dry in deck chairs, but it appears to be raining on him, and he can’t escape it! “Look up Messy!” giggles Zoe. It’s Fluff the cloud! She’s been watering Felix and Zoe’s garden and now needs to go home so invites the trio to come and meet her family.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Berrykin Blooms braggart cousin, Berrykin Bertram, has won the hot sauce competition at the local county fair year after year. But this year, Sour and Apple are determined to help the kindhearted Bloom win... whether he wants to or not!

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is finding it difficult to learn to play the violin and is fearful about performing in his school concert so he goes to Dino-World to practice.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry discovers that he is too small to pick apples he goes to the Dino-World Mooseum to find some growth enhancing milk from a mechanical cow.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this rainforest adventure, Peyo, while collecting colorful flowers, encounters a tiny, vibrant Poison Dart Frog. Pico goes into protective mode, preventing Peyo from getting too close to the potentially dangerous frog. He calls Leo and Katie, who checks on the computer and learns about Poison Dart Frogs, emphasizing their toxic nature. The frog suddenly jumps into Peyo’s satchel which calls for the team to travel to the rainforest to address the situation. As they arrive, Leo manages to get the frog out of the satchel with his grabber but the frog ends up jumping around which causes a commotion with everyone being scared to get too close. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky shows up and the frog is nowhere to be found! On high alert, they look around for the frog which ends up being on Ranger Rocky’s hat which he gently places on the ground and Peyo retrieves his satchel safely.
